answers.answer: Hello and hope you are doing well.If the sleep study showed evidence of restless leg syndrome, then you are likely to be having it. It can be treated with medications, but the first line of therapy is to correct the root causes, like iron deficiency anemia or varicose veins. Also, good sleep hygiene measures can promote sleep and prevent symptoms of restless leg syndrome. Go to bed early almost at the same time every day, wake up at the same time, avoid smoking, alcohol, caffeinated beverages and exercise regularly.Hope this helped and do keep us posted.
Thanks so very much for the response, what exactly is restless leg syndrome? I wasn't given any info they gave me prescription and told to follow up with my GP in three to four months.

Hello and hope you are doing well.Restless leg syndrome, where there is an odd sensation in the legs during sleep causing the individual to move, which relieves the sensation. This disorder can cause inadequate sleep leading to fatigue and daytime sleepiness. Studies show that approximately 50% of sufferers have a family history of the disorder. But it is also known to be associated with certain conditions. Such conditions include: iron deficiency anaemia, diabetes, alcoholism, rheumatoid arthritis, kidney failure and Parkinson's Disease. Medications which help to control the symptoms include dopamines, opiates and benzodiazepines.Hope this helped and do keep us posted.
